title: mount local filestorage for 'all users' not working
body:
hi,
i have recently upgraded to 4.5.1a and upon login my configured local filestorages were not working anymore. 

permissions on directories were correct (which is also backed up by the fact that on 4.0.8 all the mount points were working correctly). 

i tried deleting my old mount.php and recreate it using the new web interface, same issue. 
i could reproduce the issue with a fresh 4.5.1a install, both using mysql and sqlite and apache2 or nginx.
the same behaviour was reproducible using git master head revision.

turns out that setting 'all users' when creating a share through the web interface (or by writing 'all' into mount.php) does not work. directories for the shares are created but their content is always empty.

once i set the specific groups or users, shares were finally populated correctly.

please take a look into this issue because not only creating mount points is not always working correctly but there is no feedback to the admins altogether. the only thing that made me understand that it was not working correctly was that on the web interface whenever i pressed 'all users' the field remained blank, while when setting some group or user it did not.
but to date i still don't understand if this behaviour of the web interface is just obscure (but working as intended since in some way it tells the admin that the share is not working) or if this is another bug.
